greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=2; thereafter a(n) is obtained by applying Eric Angelini's remove-repeated-digits map, x->A320486(x), to n*a(n-1), stopping when 0 is reached.
reference: Eric Angelini, Posting to Sequence Fans Mailing List, Oct 24 2018
example: a(5)=240, so for a(6) we compute 6*240 = 1440 which becomes 10 = a(6).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 03 2018
